content: 1x 7x etc cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 row numbers are printed to the right of the right-side row and to the left of the wrong-side row with the exception of charts 2 and 3 where the left edge section wrong-side row are printed to the right for space reasons right-side row are white wrong-side row are shaded gray cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 each separate section right edge middle left edge is worked from right to left on right-side row and from left to right on wrong-side row the order in which to work these sections as well as the uncharted 2-stitch spine across the row is printed above each chart in blue text cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 the numbers in red at the top left of the charts represent the total number of stitches you will have on your needles after working all row of that chart because chart 2 is worked 7x each subsequent repeat which increases the count by 36 stitches is separated by slashes cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 chart 1 and the first repeat of chart 2 show all stitches as worked except for the uncharted 2-stitch spine beginning with the 2nd repeat of chart 2 and all subsequent charts the boxed sections that represent the 18-stitch pattern repeats are to be repeated across the row until just enough stitches remain to finish all the chart stitches to the next marker cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 on the right and left edge sections on all charts all decreases are worked as k2tog whether they occur on the right or wrong side of the work working the charts across the row - example chart cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 because the charts need to be very wide in order to accommodate the lace design the 2-stitch center spine is not shown the example chart below shows how to work the charts across the row on both the right and wrong sides and how these missing 2 spine stitches are positioned in relation to the charts cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 on the right-side row start at the far right of the example chart and work your way across the row from right to left on the wrong-side row start at the far left of the example chart and work your way across the row from left to right cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 remember to add the 2 center spine stitches labeled in green as you work across the row you will always work these 2 spine stitches after slipping the second marker in each row the spine stitches will always be knitted on the right side and purled on the wrong side cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 cid 1 the placement of stitch markers is coded m below slip the markers as you come to them cid 1
